remarks: Lemma for ~ lbsext .  A chain in ` S ` has an upper bound in ` S ` . (Contributed by Mario Carneiro, 25-Jun-2014.)
statement:
lbsext.v $e |- V = ( Base ` W ) $.
lbsext.j $e |- J = ( LBasis ` W ) $.
lbsext.n $e |- N = ( LSpan ` W ) $.
lbsext.w $e |- ( ph -> W e. LVec ) $.
lbsext.c $e |- ( ph -> C C_ V ) $.
lbsext.x $e |- ( ph -> A. x e. C -. x e. ( N ` ( C \ { x } ) ) ) $.
lbsext.s $e |- S = { z e. ~P V | ( C C_ z /\ A. x e. z -. x e. ( N ` ( z \ { x } ) ) ) } $.
lbsext.p $e |- P = ( LSubSp ` W ) $.
lbsext.a $e |- ( ph -> A C_ S ) $.
lbsext.z $e |- ( ph -> A =/= (/) ) $.
lbsext.r $e |- ( ph -> [C.] Or A ) $.
lbsext.t $e |- T = U_ u e. A ( N ` ( u \ { x } ) ) $.
lbsextlem3 $p |- ( ph -> U. A e. S ) $.
$d A u x z $.
$d C x z $.
$d J x $.
$d N u x z $.
$d S u x $.
$d V u x z $.
$d W u x $.
$d ph u x $.
